headline: Rwanda offers efficiency; Uganda offers value and variety
summary: Rwanda and Uganda both provide exceptional gorilla encounters. Rwanda charges $1,500 per permit but delivers a polished, efficient experienceâ€”gorilla trekking is possible in a 2-3 day trip. Uganda charges $700 per permit but requires longer, rougher travel. Uganda also offers chimps and other primates as add-ons. The right choice depends on whether you prioritize time efficiency or budget and wildlife variety.

assumptions.text: Rwanda permits cost $1,500; Uganda permits cost $700 (2024 pricing).
Rwanda is compact with good roads; gorilla trekking is accessible in 2-3 days.
Uganda requires 8-10 hour drives from Kampala to Bwindi or Mgahinga on sometimes rough roads.
Uganda offers chimp trekking in Kibale and other primate experiences not available in Rwanda.

gains: Uganda: Significant cost savings ($800+ per person)
Uganda: Chimps and other primates available

change_conditions: If time is limited to 2-3 days, Rwanda is the only practical option.
If budget matters more than comfort, Uganda saves $800+ per person on permits alone.
If chimps interest you alongside gorillas, Uganda combines both efficiently.
If wanting polish and ease, Rwanda provides a significantly smoother experience.
